LineChart.title: Line chart description
LineChart.name: LineChart
LineChart.overview: The Line chart is a combination of the basic controls  "Current Value Chart" and "History Chart". You can switch between the historical data of 1 day, 1 week, 1 month and 1 year and the live data. Exporting the respective data as CSV using the Export button also works. You can add up to 9 variables from each project per chart. All variables can be added to a chart. Examples of application : temperature profile, humidity, wind speed, etc.

table.name: Actual_Value 1 to 9
table.description: Here all variables from 1 to 9 can be mapped separately.
table.allowedValues: Min and Max from 64 Bit Variable

table.name: Scalling 1 to 9
table.description: You can use the automatic scaling of the Y-axis or you can manually enter a min and max value.

table.name: Min Max Value (Only Visible if the scalling for this Variable is Manual)
table.description: Min and Max Value for the Y-axis if you choose the Scalling in Manual Mode.
table.allowedValues: Min and Max from 64 Bit Variable

table.name: Add and Delete Value
table.description: Pressing Add will add another field. Pressing Delete will delete this field.

ColumnChart.title: Column chart description
ColumnChart.name: ColumnChart
ColumnChart.overview: The Column chart in Lynus is a combination of the basic controls "Current Value Chart" and "History Chart". You can switch between the historical data of 1 day, 1 week, 1 month and 1 year. Exporting the respective data as CSV using the Export button also works. You can add up to 9 variables from each project per chart. All variables can be added to a chart. Examples for an application : counter values like kWh, m³, quantities etc...The bar charts are optimized for values which are getting bigger and bigger.

table.name: Actual_Value 1 to 9
table.description: Here all variables from 1 to 9 can be mapped separately.
table.allowedValues: Min and Max from 64 Bit Variable

table.name: Scalling 1 to 9
table.description: You can use the automatic scaling of the Y-axis or you can manually enter a min and max value.

table.name: Min Max Value (Only Visible if the scalling for this Variable is Manual)
table.description: Min and Max Value for the Y-axis if you choose the Scalling in Manual Mode.
table.allowedValues: Min and Max from 64 Bit Variable

table.name: Add and Delete Value
table.description: Pressing Add will add another field. Pressing Delete will delete this field.

ColumnChart2.title: Column chart description
ColumnChart2.name: ColumnChart2
ColumnChart2.overview: The Column chart is a combination of the basic controls "Current Value Chart" and "History Chart". You can switch between the historical data of 1 day, 1 week, 1 month and 1 year. Exporting the respective data as CSV using the Export button also works. You can add up to 9 variables from each project per chart. All variables can be added to a chart. Examples for an application : counter values like kWh, m³, quantities etc...The bar charts are optimized for values which are getting bigger and bigger. The difference to Colum chart Nr 2 is that here not the value is displayed but the difference of 1 value to the next/last value. e.g. 1 value of the day results in 100KWh. The last value of the day is 120KWh. So not 120kw/h is displayed but 20kw/h.

table.name: Actual_Value 1 to 9

AreaChart.title: Area chart description
AreaChart.name: AreaChart
AreaChart.overview: The Line chart is a combination of the basic controls "Current Value Chart" and "History Chart". You can switch between the historical data of 1 day, 1 week, 1 month and 1 year and the live data. Exporting the respective data as CSV using the Export button also works. You can add up to 9 variables from each project per chart. All variables can be added to a chart. Examples of application : temperature profile, humidity, wind speed, etc. Same as Line Chart 1, only graphically differently represented.
